title: Energy prices might spike this winter - IEA boss
description: Governments may need to step in again and subsidise energy bills this winter says IEA boss.

title: Wimbledon 2023: Brain games and conscious breathing - the secrets of Djokovic’s success
description: Novak Djokovic is famous for his dedication and meticulous preparation, but he may let some of his strict routines slip as he tries to defend his Wimbledon title.

title: Nick Kyrgios: Australian withdraws from Wimbledon 2023 with wrist injury
description: Last year's men's singles runner-up Nick Kyrgios withdraws from Wimbledon 2023 with a wrist injury.

title: Baltimore shooting: Two dead and 28 injured in mass casualty event, police say
description: More than a dozen of the injured were under 18, a senior city official said, as suspects remain at large.

title: Wimbledon 2023: Djokovic, Swiatek, Williams in action - day one preview
description: Novak Djokovic will open proceedings on Centre Court when Wimbledon 2023 gets under way on Monday.

title: Neita beats Asher-Smith in Stockholm, protesters hit Warholm's race
description: Daryll Neita wins the women's 200m ahead of fellow Briton Dina Asher-Smith at a rainy Diamond League meeting in Stockholm.

title: The false French riot posts spreading online
description: A number of false and misleading claims about the French riots have been circulating on social media.

title: Watch: Mexican mayor weds crocodile in harvest ritual
description: The ceremony is part of an age-old ritual in which the reptile represents mother earth.

title: Joe Biden to meet King Charles and Rishi Sunak in UK visit
description: US President Joe Biden will meet King Charles at Windsor Castle on 10 July.

title: The Ashes 2023: Ben Stokes says he would have withdrawn the appeal of Jonny Bairstow dismissal
description: England captain Ben Stokes says he would not want to win with such a contentious dismissal as Jonny Bairstow's in the second Ashes Test.

title: France teen's family tell BBC police use of lethal force must change
description: One of Nahel's relatives says the riots do not honour Nahel's death, and the family want them to stop.

title: Jess Phillips not racist, Labour frontbencher says amid online row
description: A senior headteacher accused Ms Phillips of racism and bullying following a Twitter row.

title: The Ashes 2023: MCC apologises after Australia 'abused' by members in Long Room at Lord's
description: The MCC apologises after exchanges between its members and the Australian team in the Long Room at Lord's.

title: The Ashes: England v Australia - second Test, day five highlights
description: Ben Stokes' brilliant 155 is not enough to carry England to a second-Test victory over Australia at Lord's in one of the most incredible and controversial finishes in the history of the game.

title: Tour de France: Victor Lafay wins stage two as Adam Yates retains yellow jersey
description: Frenchman Victor Lafay produces a terrific late attack to claim victory on the second stage of the Tour de France.

title: Dominik Szoboszlai: Liverpool sign RB Leipzig midfielder for £60m
description: Liverpool sign RB Leipzig midfielder Dominik Szoboszlai for 70m euros (£60m), making the Hungary international their second major summer acquisition.

title: The Ashes: Staggering Stokes century not enough to deny Australia
description: Yet another sublime century from Ben Stokes cannot prevent Australia beating England at Lord's in one of the most incredible and controversial finishes ever.

title: The Ashes: Watch all Ben Stokes' sixes for England as he falls on 155
description: Watch all nine sixes hit by England captain Ben Stokes during a magnificent 155 during the second Ashes Test match at Lord's.

title: Water cremation: Co-op Funeralcare to be first UK company to offer resomation
description: The process, used in the US and Canada, will be available later this year through Co-op Funeralcare.

title: Wimbledon 2023: Novak Djokovic, Andy Murray, Elena Rybakina, Katie Boulter among stars
description: With Wimbledon starting on Monday, BBC Sport looks at the key themes going into one of the highlights of the British sporting summer.

title: Austrian Grand Prix: Max Verstappen takes fifth win in row for Red Bull
description: Red Bull's Max Verstappen continues his imperious march towards a third world title with a dominant victory in the Austrian Grand Prix.

title: Emmerdale and Coronation Street actress Meg Johnson dies
description: The soap stalwart, who appeared in Coronation Street, Emmerdale and Brookside, has died aged 86.

title: The Ashes: England captain Ben Stokes is dropped by Steve Smith on 114
description: England captain Ben Stokes is dropped on 114 by Australia's Steve Smith on a thrilling day five of the second Ashes Test at Lord's.

title: Cambridge flat fire: 'Nothing ruled out' in investigation
description: A man remains in a critical condition after a woman and two children died in a fire in Cambridge.

title: Zulu King Misuzulu kaZwelithini treated for suspected poisoning - aide
description: The king has sought treatment in Eswatini as he is uncomfortable being treated in South Africa.

title: Austrian Grand Prix 2023: McLaren's Lando Norris safety car appeal rejected
description: McLaren's request for a right to review Lando Norris' five-second penalty at the Canadian Grand Prix is rejected.

title: Ashes: Ben Stokes hits three sixes in a row to reach 100
description: England captain Ben Stokes hits three sixes to bring up a century against Australia on day five of the second Test at Lord's.

title: The Ashes: England's Jonny Bairstow is run out by Alex Carey
description: England's Jonny Bairstow is controversially run out by Australia's wicket-keeper Alex Carey on day five of the second Test at Lord's.

title: Paris riots: Suburban mayor's wife hurt as rioters attack their home
description: Attackers tried to set the house on fire before firing rockets at the mayor's fleeing wife and children.

title: Wagner: Russians reflect on group's advance towards Moscow
description: Russians have told the BBC they feared Wagner could unleash the violent tactics it uses in Ukraine on them.

title: The Ashes: Australia's Josh Hazlewood removes England's Ben Duckett for 83
description: England opener Ben Duckett is caught behind off the bowling of Australia's Josh Hazlewood for 83 on day five of the second Test at Lord's.

title: London Pride: Five Just Stop Oil protesters charged
description: Police removed protesters who briefly disrupted the annual Pride parade.

title: The Ashes: Ben Stokes survives after LBW review at Lord's
description: England captain Ben Stokes survives following a review after initially being given out LBW to Mitchell Starc on 39.

title: Big Thames Water investor backs turnaround plans
description: One of the UK's largest pension funds is the first investor to come out and support Thames Water.

title: Lord Bob Kerslake: Former Civil Service head dies aged 68
description: He was Cabinet Secretary between 2012 and 2014 during David Cameron's coalition government.

title: Spilled milk closes the M6 motorway after tanker crash
description: The M6 near Preston could be closed for most of the day after milk spilled onto both carriageways.

title: NHS England chief Amanda Pritchard says strike disruption will get worse
description: Amanda Pritchard told the BBC that "all sides" had failed to prevent further strike action.

title: English Greyhound Derby: Racing disruption attempt sees 13 arrests
description: Thirteen people were arrested over an attempt to disrupt the English Greyhound Derby, police say.

title: Protests: Police powers to tackle tactics come into effect
description: Transport network disruption and tunnelling targeted under measures for police in England and Wales.

title: Orkney council to look at proposals to become territory of Norway
description: The islands' councillors will consider a motion to investigate alternative forms of governance.

title: Stephen Lawrence murder: Friend 'could have identified sixth suspect'
description: Duwayne Brooks, who witnessed the murder, says he could have picked a sixth suspect from a line-up.

title: France shooting: Calmer night despite protests over Nahel M's murder, minister says
description: A total of 719 people were arrested as disturbances gripped Marseille and other cities with Paris quieter.

title: Labour plan to give new teachers £2,400 to stay in job
description: The party would also make it compulsory for new joiners to have a formal teaching qualification.

title: Ukraine finds British WW2 Hurricane planes outside Kyiv
description: London sent the Hawker Hurricanes to the Soviet Union to help them fight against Nazi Germany.

title: The Papers: Asbestos in schools and George's pizza at Lord's
description: No one story dominates Sunday's papers, but many carry photos of Prince George eating pizza at the Ashes.

title: Rail disruption warning due to six-day train drivers' overtime ban
description: Sixteen train companies based in England will be hit from Monday until Saturday next week.

title: More gambling clinics set up after record demand
description: Seven new addiction centres are opening in England over fears people are being "bombarded" with adverts.

title: Manchester Collective: Award-winning group a mission to shake up classical music
description: Manchester Collective are "transforming all our perceptions" of performance, one award's judges said.

title: Prince Harry, Piers Morgan and hacking: What did the bosses know?
description: Did knowledge of phone hacking by Mirror Group Newspapers journalists go right to the top?
